mt0: The Citizens' Initiative has swiftly revealed the damage to the crop on social media.

en: Launched online on the 8 September, a petition calling for the Ministry of Health to put a halt to the advertising campaign, gathered more than 1,000 signatures in four days.
amh: በሴፕቴምበር 8 የተጀመረው የድረ ገፅ አቤቱታ ዘመቻ የጤና ጥበቃ ሚኒስትር ማስታወቂያውን እንዲያስቆም በ4 ቀናት ውስጥ 1000 ፊርማዎችን አሰባስቦ አቤት ብሏል፡፡

en: Bloggers and infographics designers took the idea to task and organized a counter-campaign: We see your Khess Petch (completely white) campaign and we raise its counter: Nioul Kouk (completely black in wolof).
amh: ጦማሪዎች እና የግራፈክስ ባለሙያዎችም ይሄን ሀሳብ በመውሰድ ተቃራኒ ዘመቻ ከፍተዋል ‹‹የናንተን ኬስ ፔች (ሙሉ ለሙሉ ነጭ) ዘመቻ አይተነዋል፣ እናም ተቃራኒ የሆነውን ኒዎል ኮክ (ሙሉ ለሙሉ እንደ ዎልፍ ጥቁር) ዘመቻን ከፍተናል፡
mt0: Writers and graphic designers also took this idea and launched a counter-attack. "We saw your 'black' campaign, and we launched the counter-attack called "New Coke" (black just like Wolf).

en: A student from Hainan University threw his shoe at Maoist commentator Sima Nan on October 7, 2012, to protest against the absence of rights to free speech in China.
amh: ተማሪው ርምጃውን የወሰደው በጥያቄ እና መልስ ሰዓት ነው፡፡ ከዚህ በታች ያለው ሁኔታውን የሚያሳየው አጭር የተማሪውን ንግግር የሚያስቀምጥ ፅሁፍ ነው፡
mt0: The student took the action in the time of question and answer. The text below shows the situation in a short paragraph.

en: Before he threw the shoe, he said, even if your talk is not good, you can go back to your hotel.
amh: ‹‹ከሁሉ አስቀድሜ አቶ ሲማ ናንን እንኳን ወደ ሀይናን ዩንቨርስቲ በሰላም መቱ ለማለት እፈልጋለሁ፡፡
mt0: First of all, I want to say that Mr. Simin went to the University of China peacefully. If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: If I argue against it, certainly I will be locked up in a tiny dark room.
amh: እኔም እዚህ ተማሪ ነኝና፡፡
mt0: I'm also a student here.

en: The student took the action during a Question and Answer session.
amh: በመጀመሪያ በአንድ ወቅት ስለ ሶቅራጠስ አንብቤለሁ በአንድ እናም እኔ ማውቀው አለማወቄን ነው ይላል፡፡
mt0: First I read about aspartacus in a book and I don't know.

en: Below is a video showing the incident with a brief transcription of the student's remarks:
amh: በሁለተኝነት እኔ ነፃነት እና ዲሞክራሲን እንደ ነፃነቴ ማስጠበቂያ እፈልጋቸዋለሁ፡፡
mt0: Secondly, I want freedom and democracy as a guarantee of my freedom. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: I am also a student here.
amh: በሶስተኝነት እርስዎ ዲሞክራሲን ተቃርነው የተናገሩት ንግግር ነፃነቴን እንደተጋፋኝ ለመናገር እፈልጋለሁ፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: I want to make a few points.
amh: እኛ በእኩልነት ነፃነታችንን ማራመድ አልቻልንም፡፡
mt0: We can't exercise our freedom in equality.

en: Secondly, I need freedom and democracy is a means to protect freedom. Thirdly, I have to say, your talk against democracy has invaded my freedom. We are not equally able to exercise our freedom of speech.
amh: ምንም እንኳን የምትናገረው ጥሩ ነገር ባይሆንም፣ ወደ ሆቴልህ መመለስ ትችላለህ፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know You can return to your hotel even if you don't know what you're saying.

en: The four points that you have mentioned, I cannot go against them because of political correctness.
amh: ነገር ግን እኔ ንግግሩን ብቃወም፣ ትንሽ ጨለማ ክፍል ውስጥ እንደሚዘጋብኝ እርግጠኛ ነኝ፡፡
mt0: But if I don't reject the speech, I'm sure I'll be locked in a dark room.

en: Even if your talk is not good, you can go back to your hotel.
amh: የኔ ጥያቄም እንደሚከተለው ነው፤ ጫማየን ወደ እርስዎ መወርወር እችላለሁ?
mt0: I have the same question, can I drop my shoes at you?

en: If I argue against it, certainly I will be locked up in a tiny dark room.
amh: በዚህ ሀገር ነፃነቴን ተገፍፌያለሁ፣ እናም እዚህ የመጣሁት ነፃነቴን ለማስጠበቅ ነው፡፡
mt0: I have lost my freedom in this country, and I came here to protect my freedom.

en: Please don't interrupt me.
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know ››

en: You should have the manners not to interrupt me.
amh: ሌላ ተማሪ በወቅቱ ነበረውን ሁኔታ በጦማሩ ሲገልፅ:
mt0: Other student explained the situation in his blog:

en: Here comes my question, can I throw my shoe at you?
amh: 30 ነበር፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: As my freedom is harmed in this country, I am here to protect my freedom.
amh: ሲጀመርም ሲማ ናን የዩንቨርስቲውን አስተዳዳሪ ሊ ጂንባዎንን በማወደስ ጀመሩት፡፡
mt0: Since then, Simin started to praise the University's governor, Lee Jin-won. If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: Another student describes the scene in his blog:
amh: በእውነት ማካበድ ይችሉበታል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate it, just say you don't know.

en: The talk started at 7:30. At the beginning Sima Nan kept praising our university headmaster Li Jianbao, he is really good at flattering.
amh: የአስተዳዳሪው ስብእናም በቅፅበት ማደግ ጀመረ፡፡
mt0: The manager's character grew exponentially. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Then he pretended to be very open minded said that he was aware that some people wanted to throw things at him and invited them to throw stuff.
amh: አሰከትለውም በጣም ግልፅ ለመምሰል ሞከሩ እናም አንዳንድ ሰዎችም የተለያዩ ነገሮችን ሊወረውሩ እንደሚችሉ ይገባኛል አይነት ሀሳብ በማምጣት፤ ለዛም ዝግጁ እንደሆኑ ገለፁ፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: Since he had not started talking, people were not ready to throw things.
amh: ከዛም አራት ነጥቦችን ብቻ አስቀምጠው ቀሪውን ጊዜ ለጥያቄ እና መልስ እንደሚያዉሉት ቃል ገቡ፡፡
mt0: They then simply took four points and promised to use the rest of the time for questions and answers.

en: Then he promised that he would focus on making four points and leave more time for exchange.
amh: ንግግራቸው ረጅም፣ አሰልች እና በስህተቶች የተሞላ ነበር፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: I was too naive to believe him.
amh: አራት ነጥብ ያሉትም 1.
mt0: There are four points.

en: His talk was long, boring and full of mistakes.
amh: በፓርቲ አመራር ውስጥ ብዙ ማህበራዊ ችግሮች ይኖራሉ 2.
mt0: 2. There are many social problems in the leadership of the party.

en: His four points were: 1.
amh: የፓርቲው አመራሮች ብዙ ስኬቶች እንዳስመዘገቡ 3.
mt0: The party leaders have achieved many successes.

en: The party leaders have great achievements; 3. Without the party society would be in chaos; 4.
amh: ያለ ፓርቲ ህብረተሰቡ ማጥ ውስጥ እንደሚዘፈቅ 4 የዜጎች ዲሞክራሲ ከፓርቲው አመራር መነጠል እንደማይችሉ ናቸው፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: People's democracy should not be detached from party leadership.
amh: በንግግራቸው መካከልም አንድ ሰው ወደ አዳራሹ ሊገባ ሲል በጠባቂዎች ተከለከለ፡፡
mt0: In their conversation, a man was blocked from entering the hall. If you cannot translate, just say you don't know.

en: In the middle of his talk, someone tried to enter the hall but was stopped by the security guards.
amh: ከአንድ ሰዓት ከሰላሳ ደቂቃ ንግግር በኋላ ሲማ ናና ንግግራቸውን አቆሙ፡፡
mt0: After one hour and forty minutes of speech, Shyam ended his speech.

en: The climax was unexpected.
amh: የጥያቄ እና መለስ ጊዜውም ተጀመረ፡፡
mt0: The time for questions and answers also began. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Sima Nan finally had enough of his talk after one and a half hours.
amh: ከኔ ፊት ለፊትም አንድ ብርቱካናማ የስፖርት ልብስ ለበሰ ሰው መናገር ጀመረ፡፡
mt0: Then a man in a blue athletics shirt started to talk to me.

en: The Q & A session started.
amh: ንግግሩንም ከግሪኩ ፈላስፋ ሶቅራጠስ ንግግር ጠቅሶ ጀመረ፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: In front of me a man dressed in orange sport wear started talking.
amh: ዝርዝር ሁኔታዎችን አስገራሚ ስለነበሩ ዘንግቻቸዋለሁ፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: His main point was about freedom and equality.
amh: የንግግሩ ዋነኛ ነጥብም ነፃነት እና እኩልነት ነበር፡፡
mt0: The main point of his speech was freedom and equality.

en: He said: Today we don't have equality in our rights to speak. I have no freedom.
amh: ምንም እንኳን የተናገሩት ጥሩ ነገር ባይሆንም፣ ወደ ሆቴልዎት መመለስ ይችላሉ፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: What you have said are politically correct theories. When you are done, you go back to your hotel.
amh: ነገር ግን እኔ ንግግሩን ብቃወም ትንሽ ጨለማ ክፍል ውስጥ እንደሚዘጋብኝ እርግጠኛ ነኝ ፡፡
mt0: But I'm sure if I don't reject the conversation I will be locked in a dark room .

en: If I argue against that I would be locked up in a tiny dark room (This is all I can remember, sorry).
amh: (ይህ እኔ ላስታውስ የቻልኩት ነገር ነው፣ አዝናለሁ) ፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence, just say you don't know (I can't remember that, sorry).

en: Then Sima Nan said that it was not a question. The student then replied, Here comes my question, can I throw my shoe?
amh: ሲማ ናን አስከትለው ይህ ጥያቄ አይደለም አሉ፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Then he threw a sports shoe to the stage with determination.
amh: ተማሪውም ሲመልስ የኔ ጥያቄ ይሄው ነው፣ ጫማየን መወርወር እችላለሁ; ከዛም በቁርጠኝነት የለበሰውን የስፖርት ጫማ ወደ መድረኩ ወረወረ፡፡
mt0: The student replied, "My question is this, can I drop my shoes?" He then stood up and stood up and stood up with his athletic shoes.

en: I clapped my hand without being aware of that…
amh: እኔም ሳላስበው አጨበጭብ ነበር…
mt0: I was also laughing without realizing...

en: Sima Nan is a Maoist and in the past few years he has kept praising the North Korean model in China to advocate for a stricter approach to foreign policy.
amh: ሲማ ናን ማኦይስት ሲሆኑ ባለፉት ጥቂት አመታት ውስጥ የሰሜን ኮሪያ ሞዴል በጫይናም እንዲዳብር እና በውጭ ጉዳዮች ላይ ጠንካራ አካሄድ እንዲኖር ይፈልጋሉ፡፡
mt0: Since the last few years, Kim Nam-ae has wanted to promote the South Korean model in the clothes and to have a strong stance on foreign issues.

en: He has also propagated a lot of hate speech against liberals, accusing them of being traitors of the country.
amh: በተጨማሪም ለዘብተኞች ላይ የጥላቻ ንግግር በማድረግ እና የሀገሪቱ ስጋቶች ናቸው በሚል ውንጀላቸው ታዋቂ ናቸው፡፡
mt0: They are also famous for their hate speech and accusations of being the country's threats.

en: Many have applauded the student's courageous act, but some are also worried about the student's safety.
amh: ብዙ ተማሪዎች የተማሪውን ደፋር ተግባር ያደነቁ ሲሆን አንዳንዶች ግን የተማሪው ደህንነት አሳስቧቸዋል፡፡
mt0: Many students applauded the student's bravery, but some asked for the student's safety.

en: Below is my pick of the online discussion :
amh: ከዚህ በታች በድረ ገፅ ስለሁኔታው የነበረውን ውይይት በኔ ምርጫ አቅርቤያለሁ:
mt0: I've chosen to display the discussion on the situation below. If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: 慕容雪村: Sima Nan calls himself an intellectual and upholds Maoist ideology.
amh: ምንአልባትም በማኦ ዘመን ስለተካሄደው ማሰቃየት እና ጥቃት ዘንግተውት ይሆናል፡፡
mt0: You may have forgotten about the torture and murder that took place in the Ming dynasty.

en: He has probably forgotten about the torture and insult intellectuals went though in the Mao Era - they were forced to wear tall hats and rally on the street, beaten by belts with copper locks, forced into labour on cattle farms to reflect upon their wrongs.
amh: - በዛን ወቅት ሰዎች ረጅም ኮፍያ አጥልቀው በመንገድ ይነዱ ነበር፣ በብረት ቀበቶም ይገረፉ ነበር ፣ከብት በመጠበቅ ስራ ላይ እንዲሰማሩ በማድረግ ስህተታቸውን እንዲያምኑ ይደረጉ ነበር፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: Zhang Zhixin had his throat cut, Wang Shiwei was buried in a well after a secret execution.
amh: ዛነግ ዚን አንገቱን ተቆርጧል፣ ዋንግ ሰዊ በድብቅ ከተገደለ በኋላ ጉድጓድ ውስጥ ተቀብሯል፡፡
mt0: Zhou Jin was cut off the head, and Wang Xiao was buried in a cave after being murdered in secret.

en: Lao She and Fu Lei committed suicide… Throwing shoe at him is like a reward.
amh: ላኦ ሺ እና ፉ ሊ ራሳቸውን አጥፍተዋል… ጫማ ወደ እራሳቸው መወርወሩ ለእራሳቸው እንደ ሽልማት ነው፡፡
mt0: Lao Shi and Fu Li killed themselves... throwing shoes at themselves is like a reward.

en: 吴钩1975: Many are debating about the student's act on Weibo.
mt0: 只翻译翻译。如果不能翻译, simply say you don't know.

en: Some clapped their hands, some criticized the student for infringing other's rights.
amh: በዊቦ ብዙዎች ስለ ተማሪው ድርጊት እየተከራከሩ ይገኛሉ፡፡
mt0: Many people in Whoop are arguing about the student's actions. If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: We should have some consensus in understanding the nature of throwing shoes.
amh: አንዳንዶች አጨብጭበዋል፣ ሌሎች ደግሞ የሌሎቹን መብት መጣስ ተገቢ አይደለም እያሉ ይተቻሉ፡፡
mt0: Some laughed, others argued that other people's rights were not being violated.

en: I don't agree that throwing shoes is an attack.
amh: ጫማ ስለመወርወር ጉዳይ ስምምነት ላይ መድረስ ይኖርብናል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: It is just a form of protest by the weak side in a situation when the power is not equal.
amh: እኔ ጫማን መወርወር ጥቃት ነው ብየ አላስብም፤ ይልቅስ ደካማው ወገን ተቃውሞውን የሚገልጽበት መንገድ ነው፡፡
mt0: I don't think throwing a baton is a threat; it's a way for the weak to express their disagreement.

en: It is quite commonly seen in western countries when people throw eggs at government officials. Don't label the act.
amh: በምዕራብ ሀገሮች ወደ ባለስልጣናት እንቁላል መወርወር በጣም የተለመደ እና እንደ ጥፋት የማይይጠር ድርጊት ነው፡፡
mt0: In Eastern countries, throwing eggs at officials is a very common and unavoidable act.

en: 十年砍柴: One should not cheer for the student.
amh: 十年砍柴: ሰዎች በተማሪው ድርጊት ደስ ሊላቸው አይገባም፡፡
mt0: 十年砍柴: People should not be happy with the student's behavior.

en: In western countries, throwing eggs and shoes are common forms of expression and the punishment is light.
amh: በምእራብ ሀገሮች እንቁላል መወርወር መብት አካል ሲሆን ቅጣቱም እዚህ ግባ የማይባል ነው፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: But in China, the risk is very high.
amh: ነገር ግን በቻይና አደጋው ብዙ ነው፡፡
mt0: But in China the danger is very high.

en: This time Sima Nan does not have the power to punish the student.

en: Campus Divas For Rich Men is a Facebook page dedicated to hooking up female Kenyan university students under the age of 26 with rich men of any age.
amh: የካምፓስ ቀውጢ-ችኮች ለሀብታሞች (Campus Divas For Rich Men) ከ26 ዓመት በታች የሆኑ የኬንያ የዩንቨርስቲ ሴት ተማሪዎችን በማንኛውም ዕድሜ ክልል ውስጥ ያሉ ሀብታሞች ‘ለማጣበስ’ የተፈጠረ የፌስቡክ ገጽ ነው፡፡
mt0: Campus Divas For Rich Men is a Facebook page created to entice under-age female students from Kenyan universities to rich men in any age range.

en: The page has used the slogan Money can buy us.”
amh: ገጹ የተጠቀመበት መሪ ቃል ገንዘብ-ይገዛናል” የሚል ነው፡፡
mt0: The main word used on the page is "money-to-buy"

en: After receiving coverage on Kenya’s radio stations such as Kiss 100, Hot 96 and Classic 105 as well as exclusive coverage by Standard Newspaper, Daily Nation and Kenya’s KTN and K24 television stations; netizens created the following hashtags to discuss the Facebook page and share their opinions about it: #campusdivasforirchmen, #HakunaKituUtafanya (there is nothing to do), #CandidatesBetterThanRomney, #TeamMafisi , #wordszawazito , #Kiss100 and #KOT.
amh: ኪስ 100፣ ሀት 96 እና ክላሲክ 105 በተሰኙ የኬንያ ሬድዮ ጣቢያዎች እና በተለይ ደግሞ በስታንዳርድ ጋዜጣ፣ ዴይሊ ኔሽን እና የኬንያ ኬቲኤን እና ኬ24 ቴሌቪዥኖች ሰፊ ሽፋን ከተሰጠው በኋላ የመረብዜጎች (netizens) የሚከተሉትን ‹ሀሽታጎች› ፈጥረው በትዊተር እና ፌስቡክ ላይ አስተያየቶችን አስፍረዋል፡ - #campusdivasforirchmen፣ #HakunaKituUtafanya (ምንም ማድረግ አይቻልም)፣ #CandidatesBetterThanRomney፣ #TeamMafisi ፣ #wordszawazito ፣ #Kiss100 እና #KOT፡፡

en: The debate about the page has brought up issue such as social media monitoring, HIV/AIDS, religion and African customs, opportunities for Kenyan youth, poverty, greed and peer pressure among Kenyan university students.
amh: ስለገጹ የተነሳው ሙግት የማኅበራዊ አውታሮች ቁጥጥር፣ የኤችአይቪ/ኤድስ፣ ሃይማኖት እና አፍሪካዊ ልምዶች፣ የኬንያውያን ወጣቶች ዕድል፣ ድህነት፣ ብልሹነት እና የአቻ ግፊት በኬንያ ዩንቨርስቲ ተማሪዎች ላይ ያለው ጦስ ለውይይት እንዲነሱ አድርጓል፡፡
mt0: The debate over the post focused on social media controls, HIV/AIDS, religion and African traditions, the challenges facing Kenyan students, poverty, corruption and competition.

en: @rmresh: Campus Divas For Rich Men....desparation at its best.... @nochiel: @savvykenya Please be warned that the abhorrent Campus Divas For Rich Men page is using your old profile pic
amh: @nochiel: @savvykenya የካምፓስ ቀውጢ-ቺኮች ለሀብታሞች  ላይ ያሉ ፎቶዎች የቀድሞ የፕሮፋይል ስዕሎቻችሁ ሊሆኑ ስለሚችሉ ተጠንቀቁ፡፡

en: KTN Kenya, a television station in Kenya, used the YouTube platform to portray the Facebook page as a prostitution ring and campus students interviewed say that this is nothing out of the ordinary:
amh: የኬቲን ቴሌቪዥን፣ የዩትዩብ አለፈመደብ (platform)በመጠቀም የፌስቡክ ገጹ የሴተኛ አዳሪነት ደወል እንደሆነ እና የካምፓስ ተማሪዎችን ሲጠየቁ ይህ ከተለመደው ውጪ አለመሆኑን ሲናገሩ አሳይቷል፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Campus Divas For Rich Men is so far the boldest move in discussing matters involving Kenyan youth and sexuality openly in such a traditionally conservative society.
amh: የካምፓስ ቀውጢ-ቺኮች ለሀብታሞች በእንደዚህ ያለ ወግ አጥባቂ ማኅበረሰብ ውስጥ የኬንያ ወጣቶችን እና ወሲባዊ ተግባርን በተመለከተ በግልፅ ውይይትን በጉልህ ያራመደ ለመሆን በቅቷል፡፡
mt0: The Caribbean Crisis - Chickens for the Rich in such a conservative community has become a focal point for a debate about Kenyan youth and sexual activity.

en: So far, bloggers from 95 countries are ready to type with fast and fit fingers.
amh: እንግዲህ ከ95 ሀገሮች የተውጣጡ ጦማሪያን በነዛ ብቁ እና ፈጣን እጆቻቸው ሊከትቡ ተዘጋጅተዋል፡፡
mt0: So now, 95 journalists from 95 countries are ready to take on the task. If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: For one day they will blog about one common theme creating a colorful collection of stories and reflections that will reach a collective audience of millions.
amh: ለአንድ ቀን ሁሉም ስለ አንድ ተመሳሳይ ጉናይ ላይ በመፃፍና የሚያምር የታሪክ ፍሰት በመስራት በሚሊዮን ለሚቆጠሩ ተካታዮቻቸው ይጦምራሉ፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: On October 15, 2012 - it's Blog Action Day!
amh: ጥቅምት 15፣ 2012 - የጦማር የተግባር ቀን !
mt0: October 15th, 2012 - The Blog's Working Day!

en: Since 2007 Blog Action Day has worked to raise awareness on important issues by facilitating a yearly blog blitz.
amh: ም ጀምሮ የጦማር የተግባር ቀን በጠቃሚ ጉዳዮች ላይ ንቃትን ለመፍጠር፤ የጦማር ጥቃት ለመፈሰፀም ያስተባብራል፡፡
mt0: From the beginning of the blog a day of action encourages awareness of useful issues and encourages a debate on blogging.

en: Through the years the event has been covered on Global Voices highlighting the issues as environment, poverty, climate change, water and food.
amh: ያለፉት ዓመታት መሪ ጉዳዮችም አካባቢ፣ ድህነት፣ የአየር ንብረት ለውጥ፣ ውሃ እና ምግብ ነበሩ፡፡
mt0: The main issues of the past years were environment, poverty, climate change, water and food.

en: This year's theme is nothing less than ‘The Power of We’. How to write about 'The power of We'?
amh: የዘንድሮው ዓመት መሪ ርዕሰ ጉዳይም ‘የእኛ ኃይል’ ይሰኛል፡፡
mt0: The main theme of this year is "Our Power."

en: Photo by Maria Grabowski
amh: ፎቶ በማሪያ ግራቦውስኪ
mt0: Photo by Maria Groboshchik. If you can't translate it, just say you don't know.

en: Have you ever felt the power of working together to make a positive change?
amh: ስለ ‘የእኛ ኃይል’ እንዴት መፃፍ ይችላሉ?
mt0: How can you write about our power?

en: Write about your own effort in fighting for a cause, or maybe about a group that inspires you - in short: people's joint actions to make a difference.
amh: በርግጥም አዎንታዊ ለውጥ ለማምጣት በጋራ መስራትን አስበዉት ያውቃሉ? ያገባኛል ስለሚሉት ጉዳይ መሟገት ወይም ስለ ወሳኝ እና አነሳሽ ቡድን - በአጭሩ፡ ለውጥ ለማምጣት ሰዎች ይሰባሰባሉ፡፡
mt0: Do you really think of working together to bring positive change? Fighting for your right to be heard or talking about a significant and inspiring group - in short, people gather to bring positive change.

en: You can write your entry in any language, from any country.
amh: እርስዎም በፈለጉት ቋንቋ፣ ከፈለጉት ሀገር ሆነው መፃፍ ይችላሉ፡፡
mt0: You can also write in any language, in any country.

en: Register here to join Blog Action Day 2012 for ‘The Power of We’ on October 15 and reach an audience of millions.
amh: በጥቅምት 15/ 2012 'የእኛ ኃይል' በሚል መሪ ርዕስ የሚካሄደውን የጦማር የተግባር ቀን 2012 እዚህ ላይ በመመዝገብ ይቀላቀሉ፤ ለሚሊዮኖችም ተደራሽ ይሁኑ፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know on October 15th 2012, the blog activist's day, 'Our Power', to become a participant.

en: Follow #BAD12 for updates on Twitter.
amh: አዳዲስ ለውጦችንም ትዊተር ላይ #BAD12 ብለው ይከታተሉ፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: After witnessing its biggest protest, the anonymous organizers of the Dignity March called for another one.
amh: ትልቁን አመጽ ከተመለከቱ በኋላ ህቡዓኑ የክብር ሰልፍ” አዘጋጆች ሌላ የተቃውሞ ጥሪ አቀረቡ፡፡
mt0: After the large protest, the "Hostile protest" organizers called for another protest call.

en: Tens of thousands showed up in the areas of Mishref and Sabah Al-Salem protesting the Kuwaiti ruler's amendment of the voting law, which now allows a citizen to vote for one candidate instead of four.
amh: የኪዌት መሪዎች የመምረጥ መብት ህግን በመከለሳቸው በሚሽረፍ እና ሳባህ አል ሳሌም አከባቢዎች በአስር ሺዎች የሚቆጠሩ ሰዎች ተቃውሟቸውን ሲያሰሙ ታይተዋል፡፡ ይህ ህግ አንድ ዜጋ ለአራት እጩ ተወዳዳሪዎች የሚሰጠውን ድምጽ ወደ አንድ ያወርደዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Protesters did not find the Amir's decree constitutional and believe the new law is made to play with the coming elections in December and to weaken the opposition that won most of the parliament's seats earlier this year.
amh: ተቃዋሚዎቹ የአሚሩን ውሳኔ ሕገ መንግስታዊ ሆኖ አላገኙትም አዲሱ ህግ የተዘጋጀው በዚህ ዓመት ቀድሞ አብዛኛውን የፓርላማ ወንበር ያሸነፈውን ተቃዋሚ ፓርቲ በመጪው ታህሳስ በሚካሂደው ምርጫ ላይ ለማዳከም ነው ብለው ያምናሉ፡፡
mt0: Critics say the amendment was not constitutional. The new law was designed to weaken the opposition party in the upcoming parliamentary election in December.

en: Like the previous march, Sunday's protest witnessed smoke and tear gas bombs and several arrests of protesters, who were later released.
amh: እንደ መጀመሪያው ሰልፍ ዕለተ ሰንበት የአስለቃሽ ጢስ እና ቦንቦችን ሰለባ የሆኑ ሲሆን በርካቶችም ከታሰሩ በኋላም መለቀቃቸው ታውቋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Who is leading the protests?
amh: ተቃውሞውን የሚመራው ማነው ?
mt0: Who is leading the protest?

en: In the past few years, protests were criticized because they were led by opposition MPs.
amh: ባለፉት ጥቂት አመታት አመጸኞቹ በተቃዋሚ የፓርላማ አባላት በመመራታቸው ትችት ደርሶባቸዋል፤ በኋላ ወጣቶቹ የተቃውሞው መሪዎች ለመሆን ጥረት አድርገዋል፡፡
mt0: In recent years, protesters have been criticized for being led by opposition MPs, and then young people have tried to become the leaders of the protest.

en: Lately, the youth tried to be the leaders of those protests. This shift got bigger numbers to show up for those dignity marches.
amh: ይህ ለውጥ የክብር ሰልፎች ላይ የተሳተፉ ሰዎች ቁጥር እንዲያሻቅብ አድርጎታል፡፡
mt0: This change has made the number of people participating in the awards to rise. If you can't translate it simply say you don't know.

en: What is interesting though is that an anonymous Twitter account is the one deciding dates of both marches and the meeting points.
amh: ሌላው አስገራሚ የሚያደርገው ነገር ደግሞ የሁለቱም ሰልፎች ቀንና መነሻ ቦታ የተወሰነው በህቡዕ የትዊተር ገጽ መሆኑ ነው፡፡
mt0: Other interesting thing is that both rallies were scheduled on a secret Twitter page.

en: The account @KarametWatan tweeted a message on the 24th of October to Twitter not to revel their identity to the Kuwaiti authorities:
amh: ጥቅምት 24 @KarametWatan (በአረብኛ የሀገር ክብር) የተሰኘ የትዊተር ገጽ ትዊተር ማንነታቸውን ለኪዌት መንግስት አሳልፎ እንዳይገልጥ የሚጠይቅ መልዕክት በትዊተር አስተላለፈ፡፡
mt0: @KarametWatan (in Arabic: وطن الوطن) on October 24 tweeted a message asking Twitter not to reveal their identity to the Kuwaiti government.

en: We the people of Kuwait ask you to protect the privacy of our account details of @karametwatan from all/any officials seeking the information of the owners and/or IP addresses of the persons using and posting from the mentioned account.
amh: እኛ የኪዌት ህዝቦች የገጻችንን @karametwatan ግለኝነት እና ዝርዝር መረጃዎች በዚህ ገጽ ተጠቅሞ የሚለጥፍን ግለሰብ የበየነመረብ አድራሻ (IP addresses) ከሚፈልጉ ከሁሉም / ከማንኛውም ባለስልጣናት እንዲትጠብቁልን እንጠይቃለን፡፡
mt0: We ask all authorities to protect our privacy and details of the @karametwatan website from those who want to use our IP address to post content on this site.

en: We are responsible for the organization of a march called Dignity of a Nation in Kuwait, the largest ever march in the history of Kuwait calling for democracy, human rights, and fight against corruption.
amh: በኪዌት ታሪክ ከመቼውም ጊዜ የበለጠ ቁጥር ያለው ዴሞክራሲ፣ ሰብዓዊ መብቶችን እና ሙስናን መዋጋት የጠየቀውን ክብር ለሀገራችን” የተሰኘውን ሰልፍ የማዘጋጀቱን ሃላፊነት እንወስዳለን፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the event, just say you don't know. If you can't translate the event, just say you don't know.

en: The turn-out reached over 150,000 (around 11.5% of citizens of Kuwait) that stunned the government.
amh: ይህ ግልብጥ ብሎ የወጣው ከ150, 000 በላይ ቁጥር ያለው ህዝብ(ከጠቅላላው የከዌት ዜጋ 11.
mt0: This is a total of 150, 000 people (11% of the total population of Rwanda).

en: In return the government ordered their forces to attack the peaceful demonstration in a brutal manner that was never been seen before for no reason.
amh: በምላሹም መንግስት በአውሬነት፣ ያለምክንያት፣ ከዚህ በፊት ታይቶ በማይታወቅ መልኩ ይህን ሰላማዊ ሰልፍ እንዲያጠቁ ሀይሎቹን አዟል፡፡
mt0: In response, the government ordered the forces to attack this protest without reason, in a way never seen before.

en: Over 100 people were injured and over 50 were detained in an unlawful manner.
amh: ከመቶ በላይ ሰዎች ሲጎዱ ከሀምሳ በላይ የሚሆኑት ደግም በህገወጥ መልኩ ወህኒ ወርደዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: We do not feel safe and your protection of our privacy is pivotal.
amh: በአደጋ ውስጥ እንዳለን ይሰማናል፤ ለግለኝነታችን የምታደርጉት ጥበቃ ወሳኝ ነው፡፡
mt0: We feel in danger; your protection is important for our privacy.

en: In a comment on having a Twitter account organizing those major marches, Hamad Al-Sabah wrote:
amh: እነዚህ ትልልቅ ሰልፎችን የሚያስተባብረው የትዊተር ገጽ መሆኑ ያሰገረመው ሓማድ አል ሳባህ ይህንን አስተያየቱን አስፍሯል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: @hmalsabah: Am I the only one that is uneasy about the fact that thousands of people in #Kuwait are obeying the commands of some anonymous Twitter acct?
amh: @hmalsabah: በሺዎች የሚቆጠሩ በኪዌት ያሉ ሰዎች የአንድን ህቡዕ የትዊተር ገጽ ትዕዛዝ ማክበራቸውን ማመን የከበደኝ እኔ ብቻ ነኝ?
mt0: @hmalsabah: Is it just me that I was shocked to see thousands of people in Kuwait obeying a secret Twitter page order?

en: Should Bahrainis support Kuwaitis?
amh: ባህሬናውያን ኪዌቶችን ደግፈዋልን?
mt0: Are Brazilians supporting the Cubans?

en: Considering the sectarian remarks and support of Kuwaiti opposition figures for the Bahraini regime against the February 14th revolution, the Shia of Kuwait do not want to protest next to the opposition.
amh: የጎጠኞቹን ሐተታ ግምታ ውስጥ በማሰገባትና የኪዌት ተቃዋሚ መሪዎች የጥር 14 አብዮት የባህሬንን ስርዓት በመደገፋቸው፤ የኪዌት ሻይቶች ከተቃዋሚዎች ጎን ሆነው መሰለፍ አይፈልጉም፡፡
mt0: Because of the political debate and the support of the opposition leaders of the January 14 revolution, the Knights of the Ivory Coast doesn't want to stand with the opposition.

en: This, in result, influenced the Shia of Bahrain and started a discussion on whether Bahrainis should or should not support Kuwaiti marches.
amh: በውጤቱም የተፅእኖ ወስጥ የወደቀው ባህሬናዊ ሻይት ሰልፉን መደገፍ እንዳለባቸውና መደገፍ እንደሌለባቸው ውይይት ጀምሯል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: In comment on this topic, Bahraini Human Rights Defender Maryam AlKhawaja wrote:
amh: ለዚህ ርዕስ ምላሽ ባህሬናዊው የሰብዓዊ መብት ተሟጋች ማርያም አልካዋጃ እንዲህ ጽፏል፡፡
mt0: The Bahraini human rights activist Maryam Al-Khāwaji wrote in response to this topic.

en: @MARYAMALKHAWAJA: yes, i support anyone with righteous demands regardless of whether they support mine or not.
amh: ጥያቄዎቹ ሐቀኛ ከሆኑ እነርሱ የኔን ጉዳይ ቢደግፉም ባይደግፉም፤ የኔ ድጋፍ አይለያቸውም፡፡
mt0: If the questions are true, they will support me, whether they support or not.

en: @MARYAMALKHAWAJA: there r many of whom supported the bahrain protests who r taking part in the kuwaiti protests as well. but thats not the point
amh: @MARYAMALKHAWAJA: የባህሬንን ተቃውሞ የሚደግፉ በርካቶች በኪዌት አመጽም ሱታፌ አላቸው፤ ነጥቡ ግን ያ አይደለም፡፡
mt0: @MARYAMALKHAWAJA: Many of those who support Bahrain's protests also support the Kuwaiti protests, but the point is not that.

en: Another Bahraini activist, Ahmed Al-haddad, from the European-Bahraini Organization for Human Rights wrote :
amh: አህመድ አል ሓዳድ የተባለ ሌላ የባህሬን አራማጅ ከአውሮጳ-ባህሬን የሰብዓዊ መብት ድርጅት ይህን ጽፏል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate it simply say you don't know.

en: @DiabloHaddad: If you think you have the right to consider the Kuwaiti struggle as of Muslim Brotherhood and sectarian, then others have the right to consider yours as Shia and sectarian too.
amh: @DiabloHaddad: የኪዌትን ትግል እንደ ሙስሊም ወንድማማች እና ጎጠኛ አድርገን የመቁጠር መብት እንዳለህ ካሰብክ ሌሎች ደግሞ ያንተን (የባህሬንን ትግል) እንደ ሻይቶች እና ጎጠኛ ትግል አድረገው የመውሰድ መብት አላቸው፡፡
mt0: @DiabloHaddad: If you think that you have the right to define the Kuwaiti revolt as a Muslim brother and a nationalist, then others have the right to define your (Bahraini revolt) as a nationalist and a shepherd's revolt.

en: Other objections
amh: ሌሎች ተቃዉሞዎች
mt0: Other protests are not known.

en: Aside from the sectarian conflict, there were others who showed objection to the current protests.
amh: ከጎጣዊ ግጭት ውጭ ሌሎች ደግሞ ለዚህ አመጽ ያላቸውን ተቃውሞ አሳይተዋል፡፡
mt0: Others have also expressed opposition to this protest.

en: Hamad Al-Sabah, who thinks the coming parliament can solve this crisis instead of protests, tweeted:
amh: ከተቃውሞ ይልቅ መጪው ፓርላማ ችግሩን ይፈታዋል ብሎ የሚያስበው ሓማድ አል ሳባህ እንዲህ ተወተ፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: @hmalsabah: Let me reiterate that I believe that the protesters have a just cause, but I don't support their methods.
amh: @hmalsabah: የማምነውን እንደገና ሳስተውለው የአማጺያኑ ጥያቄ ፍትሐዊ ነው፤ ነገር ግን የሚከተሉትን መንገድ አልደግፈውም፤ በሰላማዊ መንገድ በቀላሉ ሊፈታ ይችላል፡፡
mt0: @hmalsabah: I believe that the Palestinians' demand is fair, but I don't support the following steps; it can be resolved easily by a peaceful way.

en: It can easily be solved peacefully
amh: ፋዋዝ አል ማትሩድ መለሰለት፡፡
mt0: Fāze al-Maturd replied.

en: In reply, Fawaz Al-Matroud wrote: @FawazAM: people often mistake mob rule and political freedom.
amh: @FawazAM: ህዝቦች አብዛኛውን ጊዜ በንቅናቄ ህጎች እና ፖለቲካዊ መብቶች ላይ ይሳሳታሉ፡፡
mt0: @FawazAM: People often misunderstand movement laws and political rights.

en: Just because lots of people break the law together, doesn't make them right.
amh: ብዙ ሰዎች በህብረት ህግን ስለጣሱ እነርሱን ትክክል አያደርጋቸውም፡፡
mt0: Many people simply do not know because they have broken the law in cooperation.

en: @HisHersQ8: The Amir has a point when it came to illegal protests.
amh: @HisHersQ8: ህገወጥ ተቃውሞ ጋር ስንመጣ አሚሩ ነጥብ አላቸው፤ በዓለም ዙርያ ያሉ ዴሞክራሲዎች ሁሉ የትኛውንም ህገ ወጥ ተቃውሞችን ያቆማሉ፡፡
mt0: @HisHersQ8: When it comes to illegal protest, Amir has a point; all democratic countries around the world stop any illegal protests.

en: Democracies all around the world stops any illegal protests
amh: በግለሰብ መብት የሚያምነው ካህሌድ አጃሴር ተወተ፡፡

mt0: One of the opposition activists with her speech (posted by alziadiq8)

en: And this photograph, which was shared far and wide, showing a protester, helping a security personnel, who was effected by the tear-gas:
amh: ይህ ፎቶ በስፋት እና በብዛት የተሰራጨ ሲሆን አንድ አማጺ በአስለቃሽ ጢስ ጉዳት የደረሰበት የደህንነት አባል ሲረዳ ያሳያል፡፡
mt0: This photo has been widely shared and widely distributed, showing a security officer being treated for a wound caused by a chemical weapon.

amh: ሳባህ አል ሳሌም አከባቢ የነበረውን ተቃውሞ የሚያሳይ ቪድዮ
mt0: Video shows the protest in the suburbs of Salah al-Salem. If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Did Jordanians crackdown on Kuwaitis?
amh: ጆርዳናዊያን በኪዌቶች እርምጃ ተወስዶባቸዋል ?
mt0: Doesn't know if the Jews were taken to the streets by the Jews?

en: Weeks ago, an anonymous Twitter user named Mujtahidd tweeted about Jordan sending troops to repress Kuwaiti protesters.
amh: ከሳምንታት በፊት ሙታሂድ በሚል ስም የሚራ ህቡዕ የትዊተር ገጽ የኬዌት ተቃዋሚዎችን ለማፈን ጆርዳን ወታደሮቿን ልካለች ብሎ ተወተ፡፡
mt0: Since weeks ago, a hidden Twitter account called Mutahid reported that Iraq was sending troops to suppress opposition protests in Kuwait.

en: The popular and controversial Twitter user got Salafi MP Walid AlTabtabai to tweet the news.
amh: ታወቂውን እና አወዛጋቢ ሳሊፊ የፓርላማ አባል ዋሊድ አልታባቲበያ ዜናውን በተዊተር አሰራጨው፡፡
mt0: The famous and controversial Sally shared the news on Twitter. If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Yesterday, in the protest, former MP and opposition frontman Musalam Al-Barrak gave a controversial speech.
amh: ትላንት ደግሞ የቀድሞው የፓርላማ አባል እና የተቃዋሚው ፊትአውራሪ ማስላም አል ባራክ አወዛገቢ ንግግር አደረገ፡፡
mt0: Yesterday, the former parliamentary member and opposition leader, Mohammed al-Barek, made a controversial speech.

en: The MP was jailed last week for defaming the Amir but got released in two days due to the big protests that took place in his support.
amh: ባለፈው ሳምንት የአሚሩን ክብር በማሳነሱ የታሳረ ቢሆን እርሱን የሚደግፍ ታላቅ ተቃውሞ በመቀስቀሱ በሁለት ቀናት ውስጥ ሊለቀቅ ችሏል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know Last week he was jailed for insulting Amir, but he was released in two days after a massive protest erupted against him.

en: In this video, Al-Barrak says: Security men are our brothers. If they beat you, do not react. But if they are Jordanian or Palestinian security men, then we will step on them.
amh: በዚህ ቪድዮ አልባራክ የደህነት ሰዎች ወንድሞቻችን ናቸው፤ ቢመቷችኹ አጸፋውን አትመልሱላቸው፤ ግን የጆርዳን እና ፍልስጤም የደህንነት ሰዎች ቢሆኑ ግን ተነሱባቸው” ብሏል፡፡
mt0: In this video, Al-Barack said, "Our security forces are our brothers, don't reciprocate their actions, but if they are Iraqi and Palestinian security forces, they should be taken out."

en: In reaction, Jordan's foreign ministry made a statement denying the accusations.
amh: በምላሹ የጆርዳን የውጭ ጉዳይ ሚኒስቴር ክሱን ክዶ መግለጫውን አቅርቧል፡፡
mt0: In response, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ghana rejected the accusation and issued a statement.

en: Ethiopia was among four African countries that were elected as members of the United Nations Human Rights Council on 12 November, 2012.

en: However, Ethiopia’s election to Human Rights Council did not go down well with most Ethiopians.

mt0: But when the government says "What do you say to me?" it makes us wonder; because we were told in public that we were "human rights activists."

en: Zerihun Tesfaye, an exiled journalist and blogger, described the conundrum of Ethiopia’s election in an extended Amharic note on Facebook:
amh: በደረሰበት ጫና ከሀገር የተሰደደው ጋዜጠኛ እና ጦማሪ ዘሪሁን ተስፋዬ በፌስቡክ ገጹ ይህን ለማመን የሚከብድ ‘የኢትዮጵያ መመረጥ’ እንዲህ ሲል ገልጾታል፡፡
mt0: While he was in prison, a journalist and blogger, Zarin Taufey, who was forced to leave the country, has written on his Facebook page that he is shocked by the 'Ethiopian Election'.

en: Let me chant, I can’t, I can’t as she has forgotten my cause!
amh: እስቲ ልነሳና ልበል አልቸም አልቸም

mt0: She always leaves my things alone, because she is our singer.

en: I find it easy to join this local songster and chant with him when we fall upon international organizations and governments who deafen their ears to our cause!
amh: አንዲህ ነገር ዓለሙን የተዉ ግለሰቦች፣ ዓለም አቀፍ ተቋማት እና መንግሥታት ሲያጋጥሙ አዝማሪውን ተቀብሎ ማንጎራጎሩ ሳይቀል አይቀርም።
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: But paradoxically, sometimes international organizations have a better understanding than Ethiopians themselves, about horrendous human right situations in Ethiopia and we feel better as we consider the international community is recognizing our great efforts.
amh: ስለኢትዮጵያ መንግሥት ሰብዓዊ መብት ረገጣ አንዳንዴ እኛን ባለጉዳዮቹን በሚያስደንቅ ኹኔታ የዓለም ዓቀፉ ማኅበረሰብ ሲያቀነቅን ወይ ጉድ ለካንስ እነዚህ ሰዎች የልብ አውቃ ኖረዋል ብለን ተስፋ እናደርጋለን።
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Sometimes we even think the international community is part of the revolution we aspire to in Ethiopia and our hearts fill with joy!
amh: አንድ ቀን የለውጡ አካል ሆነው የነጻነታችንን እንቀዳጃለን ብለንም ልባችን በሐሴት ትሞላለች።
mt0: If you can't translate it, just say you don't know.

en: So through journalism we used to report a lot on human rights abuse in Ethiopia.

mt0: We only work on translation if you cannot translate. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: For instance, if we report fifty innocent Ethiopians are jailed in a famous prison called Kality” some of the international community members correct us with more accurate number (120) of innocent prisoners including their names!
amh: ሌሎች የማይጠቀሱ ጉዳዮች ተደራርበው ትላንት የተባበሩት መንግሥታት የሰብዓዊ መብቶች ካውንስል ይህቺን በሰብዓዊ መብት አያያዝ የማትጠረጠር አገር አባል አድርጎ ሲመርጥ ግን የሠፈሬን አዝማሪ ማስታወስ ግድ አለኝ።

en: Then we feel these people are with us and hope good things are yet to come!
amh: በእውነት እነዚህ የመብት ተሟጋቾች እና ተቋማት ተስፋ ሊያስቆርጡን እየሞከሩ ነው?

en: But when I heard of the news of Ethiopia’s election to the United Nations Human Rights Council last evening, the hymn of our local songster rang a bell!
amh: ወይስ በየትኛውም መስፈርት አገርን ለማስተዳደር ብቃቱ የሌለው ቦዘኔ መንግሥት ምን አልባት አባል ሲሆን የጠባይ ለውጥ ያመጣ ይኾን ብለው?
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: Are these intergovernmental human rights organizations trying to destroy our optimism?

en: Or do they think a bad-mannered government will get better when it becomes a member of United Nations Human Rights Council?

mt0: The problem is that we still want their support; a hammer spins from the hammer's side.

en: Nowadays I feel everybody has become politically correct to everybody!

en: But the worse thing is still we need their help!

mt0: I am a bitch, I am a bitch, I am a bitch.

en: And another concerned netizen, Yohanes Molla, wrote :
amh: ” የጉራግኛ ተረትና ምሳሌ (ወማካ) ነው፡፡

en: There is a local proverb which says: A fool makes a donkey carry red meat and sends her along with a hyena!

en: So the hyena will chomp through the red meat and later turn on the donkey!

mt0: So, this is the result. If you can't translate the sentence, just say you don't know.

en: However, when I woke up this morning I could not escape this story!

mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: It keeps coming back to me and makes my day horrific!

en: So what could better describe Ethiopia’s election to United Nations Human Rights Council other than the proverb I cited above!

mt0: ‘I was sleeping, and when I got up, it turned out to be true, and I still have it in my mind, and I still have it in my mind.’

en: Jawar Mohammed wrote a detailed analysis of how Ethiopia secured a seat in the council.

en: But Daniel Berehane disagreed with those opposing Ethiopia's membership to the council:

en: I see no anomaly with Ethiopia being elected to the UN Human Rights Council. Both Ethiopia and the Council have good Constitutions.

mt0: Both have the capacity to operate (political, financial, etc.)

en: Perfect match.

mt0: If you can't translate it, just say you don't know.

en: Human rights groups have been criticizing Ethiopia as one of the most serious human rights violators in Africa with huge number of dissidents, activists and journalists languishing in jail.

en: This is the second time in a year that the Ethiopian government has sparked controversy involving a statue.

mt0: In addition, does that mean that there are no heroes in the area that should be remembered at the local level?

en: Regarding the renaissance dam, well I believe it is appropriate to name the dam after Meles as it is believed to be one of his ambitious plans and had full energy and commitment for its accomplishment.
amh: የሕዳሴውን ግድብ በተመለከተ፣ በመለስ ስም መሰየሙ ተገቢ ነው ብዬ አምናለሁ ምክንያቱም ግድቡ ከአስጎምጂ ዕቅዳቸው አንዱ በመሆኑና ለአፈፃፀሙም ቁርጠኝነት እና ሙሉ ኢነርጂ ነበራቸው፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: But then, I fear that this could be against Meles’s belief because when he decided to name the dam renaissance dam” he probably had a good reason for that.
amh: ነገር ግን ይህም ራሱ ከመለስ እምነት ውጪ ይሆናል ብዬ እሰጋለሁ… ምክንያቱም እርሳቸው ‹‹የሕዳሴው ግድብ›› ብለው ሲሰይሙት በቂ ምክንያት ይኖራቸዋል ብዬ እገምታለሁ፡፡
mt0: But I'm afraid that this will be beyond the confidence of Abdullah... because I think they have a good reason to call it the "water of the rainbow"

en: But still completely in support of the idea of Meles Zenawi Dam”.
amh: ነገር ግን አሁንም ‹‹መለስ ዜናዊ ግድብ›› ቢባል የሚለውን ሐሳብ እደግፈዋለሁ፡፡
mt0: But I still support the idea of a "Palace of Peace" being named. If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: As to featuring Meles’s image on any of the Ethiopia banknotes/bills, I do not think it is a good idea.
amh: ነገር ግን የመለስን ፎቶ በየብሩ ላይ ማተም የሚባለው ጥሩ ሐሳብ አይመስለኝም፡፡
mt0: But I don't think it's a good idea to print the picture of a former president on every newspaper.

en: The Ethiopian ruling party, EPRDF, has had to endure an endless censure for using the name and pictures of Meles Zenawi to unite the country under his vision.
amh: የገዢው ፓርቲ ኢሕአዴግ በመለስ ዜናዊ ራዕይ የኢትዮጵያ ሕዝብን አንድ ለማድረግ በስማቸው እና በምስላቸው መጠቀሙን መቀጠል አለበት፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know. The ruling party needs to continue to use their name and image to unite the people of Ethiopia.

en: However, some people feel that the party is abusing the late leader to the maximum.
amh: ምንም እንኳን አንዳንድ የፓርቲ ሰዎች መለስን አላግባብ ፓርቲው እየተጠቀመባቸው እንደሆነ እየተሰማቸው ቢሆንም፡፡
mt0: Although some party members feel that the party is using Paul inappropriately.

en: In an open memo, Kirubel Teshome asks the widow of Meles Zenawi to stop cheap adoration of her dead husband:
amh: በግልጽ ማስታወሻው፣ ክሩቤል ተሾመ የሟች መለስ ዜናዊ ባለቤት ስለባለቤታቸው እያወሩ ያሉትን ርካሽ የፍቅር ወሬ እንዲያቆሙ ጠይቋል:-
mt0: In a clear note, Carolyn T. asked the former wife of late President Mohammed Zine-Adei to stop gossiping about her. If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Open memo to W/ro Azeb Mesfin: Can you please, please, please, tell the Addis Ababa .A city administration to stop violating the wish of the late PM. You openly told Ethiopians and the world that Meles was not a kind of person that indulges individual fame or cult.
amh: - እባክዎ፣ እባክዎ፣ እባክዎ ለአዲስ አበባ አስተዳዳሪዎች እርስዎ መለስ የግል ዝና እና ሰብእና ግንባታ አይወዱም በማለት ለኢትዮጵያ ሕዝብ በግልጽ የተናገሩትን የመለስ ምኞት መጣስ እንዲያቆሙ ይንገሯቸው፡፡
mt0: Please tell the chiefs of the capital that you don't like their personal fame and their personal character, as they explicitly said to the people of Ethiopia, that you don't like their personal fame and their personal character.

en: You revealed how he would have disliked to see all this images of him being a wall paper of the city.
amh: ምስላቸው የከተማዋ የግድግዳ ሽፋን ሆኖ ማየት እንዴት እንደሚጠሉ ነግረውናል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: I am sure, by now, you may have noticed how the city administration have been relentless in advancing against his legacy by painting the town with pictures of the late PM.
amh: እርግጠኛ ነኝ አሁን፣ የከተማዋ አስተዳደር ያለምንም እረፍት ከተማዋን በመለስ ምስል ከመለስ ውርስ በተቃራኒ እያጥለቀለቀው መሆኑን አስተውለዋል፡፡
mt0: I'm sure now, the city administration is taking over the city without a rest, surrounding it with the image of Paul, against Paul's tradition. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: I wonder why they dont wish to let him have peace at least on his death?
amh: ቢያንስ ከሞታቸው በኋላ እንኳን እረፍት እንዲያደርጉ ለምን እንዳልፈቀዱላቸው ግራ ገብቶኛል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know. I wonder why they didn't allow them to rest even after they died.

en: It is also against his legacy to see cleaner and greener Addis.
amh: አሁንም የፀዳችና አረንጓዴ አዲስ አበባን ማየት ውርሳቸው ነበር፡፡
mt0: However, they still loved to see the sunny and green New Delhi.

en: Can you please call for the immediate collection of his images from the walls, fences and buildings of Addis?
amh: ስለዚህ እባክዎ ባስቸኳይ ምስሎቻቸው ከከተማዋ ግድግዳዎች፣ አጥሮች እና ሕንፃዎች ላይ እንዲነሱ ያድርጉ፡፡
mt0: Please immediately remove their images from the walls, roofs and buildings of the city.

en: It would be a favor that the people of Addis will not forget!
amh: የአዲስ አበባ ሕዝቦች መቼም የማይዘነጉት ውለታ ይሆንልዎታል!
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know The people of Hyderabad will never forget your contribution!

en: Since his death, the late prime minister has been praised for the economic growth Ethiopia has claimed to have recorded over the past two decades.
amh: ሞታቸው ከተሰማ ጀምሮ፣ የቀድሞው ጠቅላይ ሚኒስትር የኢትዮጵያ ኢኮኖሚ ላለፉት ሁለት ዐሥርት ዓመታት ላስመዘገበው የዕድገት ክብረወሰን ሲሞገሱ ከርመዋል፡፡
mt0: Since the announcement of his death, the former Prime Minister has been lauding the growth of the Ethiopian economy for two centuries. If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: By the same token, he has also been criticized for jailing political activists and journalists, using vaguely defined terrorism offenses.
amh: በተመሳሳይም፣ የፖለቲካ አራማጆች እና ጋዜጠኞችንም አሻሚ ትርጉም ባለው የአሸባሪነት ወንጀል በማሰራቸውም ይወቀሳሉ፡፡
mt0: In addition, politicians and journalists are also accused of being involved in a terrorist plot.

en: Ethiopians across the world are celebrating TeamEthiopia, their national Soccer team, who fought a hard draw against defending champions Zambia in the 2013 Africa Cup of Nations in Nelspruit, South Africa.
amh: በመላው ዓለም ያሉ ኢትዮጵያውን የኢትዮጵያ ብሔራዊ እግር ኳስ ቡድን ከባለፈው ዓመት የ2012 የአፍሪካ አገራት ዋንጫ ሻምፒዮን ጋር በኔልስፕሩት፣ ደቡብአፍሪካ ያደረገውን ከባድ ግጥሚያ በድምቀት እያከበሩ ነው፡፡
mt0: Around the world, Ethiopians are celebrating the heavy match between the winners of the 2012 African Cup of Nations in Namibia. If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: Besides the beauty of the Ethiopian game and the composure the players showed after a long absence from the AFCON tournament, Ethiopian politics was at the centre of online discussion.
amh: ከኢትዮጵያውያኑ ውብ አጨዋወት እና ከረዥም ጊዜ መጥፋት በኋላ በአፍሪካ ዋንጫ ከታየው ድንቅ የተጫዋቾች ችሎታ ባሻገር፣ የኢትዮጵያ ፖለቲካ ከኳሱ ጎንለጎን ማዕከላዊ የውይይት አጀንዳ ለመሆን በቅቶ ነበር፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Ethiopian fans in the stadium displayed various placards and flags representing different political interests.
amh: በስታዲየሙ ጨዋታውን ለመመልከት የገቡት ኢትዮጵያውያን የተለያዩ ጽሑፎችን እና ባንዲራዎችን ሲያውለበልቡ ታይተዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Ethiopian Muslims protest the Ethiopian Government while supporting the Ethiopian Team in South Africa at The Cup of African Nations 2013.
amh: የኢትዮጵያ ሙስሊሞች የኢትየጵያ ቡድንን በደቡብ አፍሪካው የ2013 የአፍሪካ አገራት ዋንጫ ላይ እየደገፉ የኢትዮጵያ መንግሥት ላይ ያላቸውን ተቃውሞ አስደምጠዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: From the Awolia School Support Page Facebook Page
amh: ፎቶው የተገኘው ከአዎሊያ ትምህርት ቤት ደጋፊዎች የፌስቡክ ገጽ ነው፡፡
mt0: Photo was taken from the school's Facebook page. If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: In a bid to create a sense of deja vu for Ethiopians the blog Addis Rumble published a few historical photos from old AFCON tournaments in which Ethiopia had participated.
amh: Addis Rumble የተሰኘ ድረገጽ ደግሞ በበኩሉ ከዚህ ቀደም ኢትዮጵያ የተሳተፈችባቸውን የአፍሪካ አገራት ዋንጫ ጫወታዎችን ለትዝታ ያክል ለጥፏቸዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: In the pictorial post titled, The Ethiopian comeback it wrote:
amh: ‹የኢትዮጵያ መመለስ› የሚል ርዕስ በሰጡት በዚህ ጽሑፋቸው የሚከተለውን አስፍረዋል፡
mt0: In his article titled "The Return of Ethiopia" he explained the following:

en: This week Ethiopia is making a surprise comeback at the 2013 Cup of Nations in South Africa after knocking out neighboring rivals Sudan through an aggregate 5-5 draw in the final qualification round.
amh: በዚህ ሳምንት፣ ኢትዮጵያ በድንገቴ ድል ጎረቤታችን ሱዳንን በደርሶ መልስ ጫወታ 5 ለ 5 በመርታት የመጨረሻውን ዙር አልፋ ለ2013 የአፍሪካ ዋንጫ ለመሳተፍ በቅታለች፡፡
mt0: This week, Ethiopia ended a surprise win over neighbor Sudan 5 to 5 in a tie-break to qualify for the 2013 African Cup of Nations.

en: In the days after the qualification was secured in October last year, Addis seemed like a transformed city.
amh: ለዋንጫ ጨዋታው ማለፏ ከተረጋገጠ ወዲህ ባሉት ቀናት፣ ከጥቅምት ወር ወዲህ አዲስ አበባ የተለወጠች ከተማ መስላ ሰንብታለች፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Previously you would hardly notice any football celebrations in the cityscape (other than of the usual English Premier League teams) but following the qualification most of the capital’s blue taxis and mini-buses – usually the best way of distilling public opinion – started displaying posters of the national team with a ‘Yes We Can’ text added.
amh: ከዚህ በፊት (ከተለመደው የእንግሊዝ ፕሪሚየርሊግ ወግ በቀር) ብዙም የደመቀ የኳስ ወሬ የማይስተዋልባት ከተማ በዚሁ ወሬ ተጠምዳ ሰንብታለች… ብዙ ጊዜ የሕዝብ አስተያየት እንደሚንፀባርቅባቸው የሚታመኑት የታክሲ ውስጥ ጽሑፎች ሳይቀሩ… ‹አዎ እንችላለን› የሚል ጽሑፍ ለጥፈው ታይተዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: The occasion was also packed with interesting Ethiopian political tidbits.
amh: አጋጣሚው የተለየ የፖለቲካ ጣዕምም ተቋድሷል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the situation simply say you don't know.

en: Mohamed Ademo, a blogger based in New York wrote on Facebook about how different groups stood behind one team despite their variation on the political and cultural spectrum:
amh: ሞሐመድ አዴሞ የተሰኘ፣ ኢትዮጵያዊ የኒውዮርክ ጦማሪ በፌስቡክ ገጹ ላይ የተለያየ የፖለቲካ አመለካከት ያላቸው ሰዎች ከነፖለቲካ ልዩነታቸው አንድ ቡድንን ለመደገፍ የቆሙበትን ሁኔታ እንደሚከተለው ገልጾታል፡
mt0: Mohammad Adeem, an Ethiopian journalist in New York, describes the situation in which different political opinions have stood up for a particular party.

en: Sport brings people together.
amh: ስፖርት ሕዝቦችን አንድ ያደርጋቸዋል፡፡
mt0: Sports makes people united. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: The cheerful Oromo crowd in South Africa today is a good example of that.
amh: የደስተኞቹ ኦሮሞዎች ስብስብ ዛሬ በደቡብ አፍሪካ ያንን የሚያስመሰክር ነው፡፡
mt0: The Ethiopian diaspora is proving that today in South Africa.

en: In the states, rarely do we see both sides (Oromo and other Ethiopians) cheering for the same team.
amh: በአሜሪካ ሁለቱ ወገኖች (ኦሮሞዎች እና ሌሎቹ ኢትዮጵያውያን) አንድ ቡድን ለመደገፍ የምንገናኝበት ዕድል በጣም ጠባብ ነው፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: We have separate sporting tournaments and federations.
amh: የተለያዩ የስፖርት ግጥሚያዎች እና ፌዴሬሽን ነው ያለን፡፡
mt0: We have different sports and federations. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: For Ethiopia's football fans in South Africa, the choice today was between OLF flag, the defacto Oromo flag, and the EPRDF (Ethiopia's ruling party) flag.
amh: ዛሬ በደቡብ አፍሪካ ላሉ የኢትዮጵያ እግር ኳስ ደጋፊዎች ምርጫው በኦነግ ባንዲራ እና በአገልግሎት ላይ ባለው የኦሮሞ ባንዲራ መካከል ነበር፡፡
mt0: Today, for Ethiopian football fans in South Africa, the choice was between the opposition flag and the operating Ethiopian flag.

en: As you have said so eloquently, whether the Oromo and non-Oromo fans of Team Ethiopia displayed different flags didn't matter. They both supported one team.
amh: እናንተም ቀድማችሁ በግልጽ እንዳስመሰከራችሁት፣ ኦሮሞም ሆኑ የኦሮሞ ያልሆኑ የኢትዮጵያ ቡድን ደጋፊዎች የሚያውለወልቡት ባንዲራ ልዩነት ምንም ችግር የለውም፤ ምክንያቱም ሁሉም የሚደግፉት አንድ ቡድን ነበር፡፡
mt0: You also pointed out that the difference in the flag doesn't matter, as you already pointed out, because all supporters of the Ethiopian team supported the same team.

en: For far too long, at international sporting events and bazaars, a monolithic image of Ethiopia have been presented to the world.
amh: ለረዥም ጊዜ፣ የዓለም አቀፍ የስፖርት እንቅስቃሴዎች፣ አንዲት ኢትየጵያን ለዓለም ሲያስተዋውቅ ነበር፡፡
mt0: For a long time, international sport events have been selling an entire country to the world.

en: An Ethiopia with 3000 years of history that is still a christian island, has one flag, and speaks only Amharic.
amh: የ3000 ዓመት ታሪክ ያላት፣ የክርስትያን ደሴት፣ አንድ ባንዲራ ያላት እና አንድ አማርኛ የምትናገር ኢትዮጵያን፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Ethiopia has a 3000-year history, a Christian island, a flag and an alphabet.

en: But in reality, Ethiopia is a truly diverse nation with divergent aspirations and historical experiences.
amh: እውነታው ግን፣ ኢትዮጵያ የብዝኃ-ብሔሮች አገር በተለያዩ ታሪኮች እና ባሕሎች የተገነባች መሆኗ ነው፡፡
mt0: But the truth is that Ethiopia is a multi-ethnic country with diverse history and customs.

en: As a result, contending national sentiments (isms) have emerged.
amh: በውጤቱም፣ ብሔራዊ ስሜቶች እየጎሉ መጥተዋል፡፡
mt0: In the end, national feelings have become weaker. If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: Under previous Ethiopian regimes, for example, the use of Afan Oromo in public spaces and government offices was banned.
amh: ባለፉት የኢትዮጵያ መንግሥታዊ ሥርዐቶች ለምሳሌ፣ ኦሮምኛ መናገር በሕዝባዊ ስፍራዎች እና በመንግሥት ጽ/ቤቶች ውስጥ የተፈቀደ አልነበረም፡፡
mt0: For example, in the past Ethiopian governments, it was not allowed to speak Armenian in public places and in government offices.

en: In EPRDF's Ethiopia, while linguistic and cultural rights are - at least in theory - respected, wearing or displaying an OLF flag amounts to an act of terrorism.
amh: በኢሕአዴግ ኢትዮጵያ፣ የቋንቋና የባሕል መብቶች - ቢያንስ በኀልዮት ደረጃ ቢከበሩም የኦነግን ባንዲራ ማውለብለብና መልበስ በሽብርተኝነት ያስቀጣል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: What you saw today (the bitching and moaning about Oromo flag from those who still want to control the narrative of Ethiopia) is an extension of that false sense of unity.
amh: ዛሬ ያያችሁት (ስለኦሮሞ ሕዝብ ያለውን ትርክት ለመቆጣጠር የሚፈልጉ ሰዎች ስድብ እና ዘለፋ) የመነጨው ከዚህ የሐሰት የአንድነት ቀኖና ነው፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. What you've seen today (the abuse and rumors of people trying to control the myth of the Oromia people) comes from this false unity doctrine.

en: I concur with you that, at the absence of national consensus, the way forward is to recognize our differences and respect people's rights to identify however they see fit.
amh: ከናንተ ጋር የምስማማው፣ ልዩነታችንን በመቀበል እና ሕዝቦች ያመኑበትን በማክበር ወደፊት መቀጠል ስንችል ነው፡፡
mt0: I agree with you, that we can continue to move forward by accepting our differences and respecting what people believe.

en: In the same vein, our Oromo activists should also stop pouncing on every chance to question the nationalism of those who are passionate football fans - and chose to look beyond politics.
amh: በተመሳሳይ መንገድ፣ የኦሮሞ አራማጆቻችን ከፖለቲካ አጀንዳ አፈንግጠው ኳሱን ብቻ ለመመልከት የፈለጉትን የኳስ አፍቃሪዎች ስሜት በብሔር ነክ ጥያቄዎች ማስጨነቃችሁን ማቆም ይኖርባችኋል፡፡
mt0: In the same way, our advocates for the Oromia should stop worrying the football fans who wanted to see the game alone, without politics.

en: All the while, it's imperative to stay civil and use this opportune moment to ask: who is Ethiopian, what's the Ethiopian identity, does the EPRDF flag represent the aspirations of the diverse people of Ethiopia, does waving OLF flag automatically make one a secessionist, why do Oromos love the OLF flag, why are non-Oromo Ethiopians so scared of assertive Oromo nationalism etc.
amh: ይህም ሆኖ ሳለ፣ እንደአንድ አስተዋይ ዜጋ የሚከተሉትን ጥያቄዎች መጠየቅ ተገቢ ይሆናል፡ - ማነው ኢትዮጵያዊ፣ የኢትዮጵያዊነት መለያ ምንድን ነው፣ የኢሕአዴግ ባንዴራ የኢትዮጵያዊ ብዝኃነትን ይወክላል፣ የኦነግን ባንዲራ ማውለብለብስ ገንጣይ ያሰኛል፣ ለምን ኦሮሞዎች የኦነግን ባንዲራ ይወዱታል፣ ለምን ኦሮሞ ያልሆኑ ኢትዮጵያውያን ኦሮሞነታቸውን የሚወዱ ኦሮሞዎችን ማየት ያስደነግጣቸዋል… ወዘተ፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: Shared by Ermias M Amare on Facebook
amh: Ermias M Amare በተባለ የፌስቡክ ተጠቃሚ የተለጠፈ
mt0: If you can't translate it simply say you don't know. It was posted by Ermias M Amare, a Facebook user.

en: On Twitter, under the hashtags of #TeamEthiopia and #Eritrea, there was also a great deal of discussion about sport and politics!
amh: #TeamEthiopia እና #Eritria በሚሉ ሀሽታጎች ትዊተር ላይ ስፖርትና ፖለቲካ ላይ ያተኮሩ በርካታ ውይይቶች ተካሄደዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Kweschn Media tweeted:
amh: ክዌስችን ሚዲያ የተባለ ተጠቃሚ ያሰፈረውን ትዊት እንመልከት:-
mt0: Let's see a tweet by a user named Crowdy Media:

en: While #Zambia's fans waved only 1 flag, #Ethiopia's side had more than 2 flags.
amh: የ #ዛምቢያ ደጋፊዎች አንድ ባንዲራ ብቻ ሲያውለበልቡ፣ የ#ኢትዮጵያ ደጋፊዎች ከሁለት በላይ ባንዲራዎችን አውለብልበዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: But for Zerihun it would have been great for Eritreans if Eritrea was still a part of Ethiopia.
amh: ፖለቲካ የተቀባ ኳስ - መፍትሔ ያልተሰጣቸው ጉዳዮች ነፀብራቅ፡፡
mt0: Political soccer - a reflection of problems that are not resolved.

en: Mentioning the alleged failed coup attempt by Eritrean rebel soldiers, he tweeted:
amh: ለዘሪሁን ደግሞ ኤርትራ እስካሁን የኢትዮጵያ አካል ብትሆን ለኤርትራውያን ጥሩ እንደነበር በዕለቱ ተካሄደ ስለተባለው የመፈንቅለ መንግሥት ሙከራ እየጠቀሰ ይናገራል፡፡
mt0: For Zarin, Eritrea was a good thing for the Eritreans when it was a part of Ethiopia, referring to the coup attempt that took place on the same day.

en: If you hadn't been allowed to secede, you could have enjoyed the game with us :) #Ethiopia makes fun of today's #Eritrea Coup #TeamEthiopia
amh: ለመገንጠል ባትፈቅዱ ኖሮ፣ ይህንን ጫወታ አብራችሁን ትደሰቱበት ነበር #ኢትዮጵያ በዛሬው የአፍሪካ የመፈንቅለ-መንግሥት ሙከራ ተደስታለች፡፡
mt0: If you didn't allow us to separate, you would have enjoyed this game.

en: Ethiopia will face Burkina Faso in the second match of group C of the AFCON tournament while Zambia will play Nigeria.
amh: ኢትዮጵያ በአፍሪካ ዋንጫ ቡድን ሲ ውስጥ ከተመደበችው ቡርኪና ፋሶ ጋር፣ ዛምቢያ ደግሞ ከናይጄሪያ ጋር ቀጣይ ጫወታ ታደርጋለች፡፡
mt0: Ethiopia will play Burundi and Zambia with Nigeria in the Africa Cup of Nations.

en: The 2013 Africa Cup of Nations, also known as the Orange Africa Cup of Nations, is 'the' football championship of Africa organized by the Confederation of African Football (CAF).
amh: የ2013ቱ የአፍሪካ አገራት ዋንጫ፣ የብርቱካናማ የአፍሪካ አገራት ዋንጫ በመባልም ይታወቃል፣… በአፍሪካ የእግርኳስ ኮንፌዴሬሽን የሚዘጋጅ የአፍሪካ እግርኳስ ሻምፒዮኖች መለያ ነው፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know 2013 African Cup of Nations, also known as the Caribbean African Cup of Nations, is the emblem of the African Football Federation.

en: This is the 29th Africa Cup of Nations, and is being held from 19 January to 10 February 2013.
amh: ይህ 29ኛው የአገራት ዋንጫ ሲሆን ከጥር 11/2005 እስከ የካቲት 3/2005 ድረስ ይዘልቃል፡፡
mt0: This is the 29th Nations Cup. It will take place from January 11 to February 3 2005.

en: What is it like to be a student at the Indigenous University of Venezuela ?
amh: የቬንዙዌላ አገርበቀል ዩንቨርስቲ ተማሪ መሆን ምን ይመስላል?
mt0: What is it like to be a student at the University of Venezuela?

en: Three students from the department of edu-communication recently took part in a workshop led by Rising Voices in order to learn how to take better digital photographs and how to upload and share them on the internet
amh: ከትምህርታዊ ተግባቦት የወጡ ሦስት ተማሪዎች በእያደጉ ያሉ ድምፆች ትዕይንተ ሥራ ላይ ዲጂታል ፎቶዎችን እንዴት ማንሳት፣ በይነመረብ ላይ መስቀል እና ማጋራት እንደሚቻል ለመማር ተሳትፈው ነበር፡፡
mt0: When they were out of class, three students participated in the Expanding Voices workshop to learn how to take digital photos, share them on the Internet and share them on social media.

en: These three students are part of an effort to showcase this unique university designed to provide an intercultural and experimental form of education to students from Venezuela's indigenous communities.
amh: እነዚህ ሦስት ተማሪዎች፣ በዚህ ልዩ ዩንቨርስቲ ውስጥ ከቬንዙዌላ ማኅበረሰብ የተውጣጡ እና በይነባሕላዊ እና ተግባራዊ የትምህርት ዓይነቶችን እንዲለዋወጡ የሚደረገው ጥረት ማሳያ ናቸው፡፡
mt0: These three students are a demonstration of the effort to integrate the diverse communities of Venezuela into this special university. If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: By accessing the university's satellite connection, which was provided by the government program called Infocentros , the students are able to access the internet to share images of activities, facilities, and the stunning nature that surrounds the 2,000-hectare campus located in the state of Bolívar.

en: The crónica is a Portuguese writing form that is very suited to blogging - originally published in newspapers, they are tales, sometimes true and sometimes fictionalized, that convey a point or a conceit in a very short form. In her blog Sweet Cliché, Alves writes short tales, often about love and intimate encounters.
amh: cronista” ማለት በፖርቱጋል ቋንቋ መጦመር የሚለውን ቃል ተስተካካይ ትርጉም የሚሰጥ ሲሆን - ፅሁፎቹ ባብዛኛ ጊዜ በጋዜጣ የሚታተሙ ታሪኮች አንዳንዴ እውነተኛ ተሪኮች ሌላ ጊዜ ደግሞ የፈጠራ ልብ ወለዶች ሲሆኑ ብዙውን ጊዜ የራስ ችሎታን በአጭሩ ያሳያሉ፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know cronista. "Cronista" means in Portuguese to write a substitute for the word "cronist" - these letters are usually published in the press, sometimes true stories, sometimes fiction, often a brief summary of one's own talents.

en: (Blogspot warns readers of the adult nature of her blog). Here's an excerpt from her most popular recent post Matei o meu amor - I killed my love:

en: In the old days, we could say that it was a question of conservatism.
amh: ጊዜው ጥንት ቢሆን ኖሮ የወግ አጥባቂነት ጥያቄ ነው እንል ነበር፣ ነገር ግን በማህበረሰባችን ውሰጥ በርካታ ለውጦች በሚካሄዱበት በአሁኑ ወቅት ነውር ለሚባለው ነገር ምንም ቦታ የለኝም፡፡

en: At four years old, I really wanted to read a storybook that my dad gave me, so he took me to a tutor who helped me read and write before I went to primary school.
amh: አባቴ የቤት ውስጥ አስተማሪጋር ወስዶኝ ገና መጀመሪያ ደረጃ ትምህርት ቤት ከመግባቴ በፊት ማንበብና መፃፍ ቻልኩ፡፡ በጀርባዬ የደብተር ቦረርሳ ተሸክሜ ሁሌም አስተማሪዬ ጋር እመላለስ ነበር፣ እስካሁንም ድረስ እነዚህ የልጅነት ጣፍጭ የምንግዜም ትዝታዎቼ ናቸው፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know My father took me to a home teacher before I went to school. I always took a notebook with me and always went with my teacher, these memories are still my memories of childhood.

en: I would go there every day, with my backpack on my back.
amh: GV: በአንጎላ ያሉ የአንቺ ዘመን ትውልዶችን እንዴት ትገልጪያቸዋለሽ?
mt0: GV: How do you define the generation of your generation in Nigeria?

en: Even up until now, they were the most beautiful moments I've lived.
amh: የኔ ዘመነኞች በታላቅ ለውጥ ውስጥ የሚኖሩ ናቸው፡፡
mt0: My generation is living in a great change. If you can't translate it, just say you don't know.

mt0: It's a generation that can dream and have a wonderful talent.

en: My generation is living through great changes.
amh: መጥፎው ነገር እምቅ ችሎታ እንዳላቸው የተረዱት ጥቂቶች ናቸው፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate it, just say you don't know.

en: It is a very able generation, full of dreamers and people with a lot of potential.
amh: በሌላ በኩል የኔ ትውልድ እርስ በእርሱ ተወዳዳሪ ነው ፡፡
mt0: In the other hand , my generation is competing . If you can't translate it simply say you don't know .

en: Too bad few really know their own .
amh: ግን በዙሪያችን ያሉ ስዎች በአንድ አላማ ስር ሲሰባሰቡ አናይም፡፡
mt0: But we don't see people gathered under one goal.

en: On the other hand, we're very competitive, we cannot see those around us and come together for the same cause.
amh: ጥቂቶች ብቻ ናቸው ‘ህብረት’ እና ‘በአንድ አላማ መትጋት’ የሚሉትን ቃላት ፍቺ የሚያውቁ፡፡
mt0: Only few people know the meaning of the words 'unity' and 'work for one goal'.

en: Few know the meaning of the words union and solidarity.

mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: We have more access to information, and even so we act as though we live in the stone age.

mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know in Angola a common saying is that "a young man who doesn't dance in a party is not a young man."

en: In Angola, there's the phrase a young person who does not party is not a young person. Youth today only wants to party. Without generalizing, because of course there are exceptions.
amh: ወጣቶች ዛሬ ዛሬ መጨፈር ብቻ ነው የሚሹት ፣እርግጥ ነው ሁሉንም ወጣቶች በደፈናው በአንድ ማጠቃለሌ አይደለም፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: GV: Do you fit into a larger blogging scene in Angola?

en: I have online peers, the Angolan blogosphere grows by the day.
amh: ገፁን እርስ በእርሳችን ለመደጋገፍ እንዲሁም ስራዎቻችንን ለበለጠ አንባቢያን ለማዳረስ እንጠቀምበታለን፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know. We will use the page to foster cooperation and to promote our work to more readers.

en: It is where we converse, trade ideas, and experiences.
amh: ሃሳቦችን ልምዶችን የምንገበያይበት አይነተኛ መንገድ ነው፡፡
mt0: It's a great way to sell ideas and experiences.

en: And not just there, I have peers in other countries around the world.
amh: ከአንጎላ ብቻም ሳይሆን ተጨማሪ በተለያዩ አገሮች በመላው አለም በይነ መረብ ጓደኞችአሉኝ፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: What should I call him?- Call him love.

mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: GV: Tell us about your writing process.
amh: GV: ስለአፃፃፍ ሂደትሽ ንገሪን?
mt0: GV: Tell me about your writing process.

en: What are your greatest challenges?
amh: ስትፅፊ የሚያጋጥምሽ ችግሮችም ምንድን ናቸው?
mt0: What are the problems you may have when writing?

en: Generally, I pick up my mobile and I begin to write and in less than two hours, I finish. Sometimes I spend two weeks developing a text, and it even really frustrates me.
amh: በአጠቃላይ የሞባይል ስልኬን አውጥቼ መፃፍ እጀምራለሁ፣ ከሁለት ስዓት በሚያንስ ጊዜ ውስጥ እጨርሳለሁ፡፡
mt0: I usually start writing on my mobile phone, in less than two hours.

en: One of my great challenges, if not the only, is to make the reader find himself/herself in what I write, and I can say that I have achieved that based on the feedback I receive.
amh: አንዳንድ ጊዜ ደግሞ እንድ ፅሑፍ ለማቀናበር ሁለት ሳምንት የፈጅብኛል፣ ያኔ ትክት ነው የሚያደርገኝ፡፡ ብቸኛው ባይሆንም አንዱና ዋንኛው ችግሬ አንባቢዎቼ በፁሑፌ ውስጥ ራሳቸውን እንዲያገኙ ማድረጉ ላይ ነው፡፡
mt0: Some times it takes me two weeks to write a single article, that makes me sick. One of the biggest problems is that I can't get my readers to find themselves in my writing.

en: GV: Who are your readers, do you know?

mt0: G: Do you know your readers?

en: How do people react to what you write?

mt0: What do people say about books?

en: I can say that many people read it.
amh: ብዙ ሰዎች ፅሑፌን ያነባሉ ማለት እችላለሁ፡፡
mt0: Many people can read my text. If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: With that I mean: all ages groups, in the most diverse group of countries.
amh: ይህንንም ስል በተለያዩ የአለማችን ክፍሎች በተለያዩ የእድሜ ክልል ውስጥ ያሉ ስዎችን ማለቴ ነው፡፡
mt0: This also means that people in different parts of the world in different ages are being called.

en: It is strange, but according to the statistics, the country that most visits my blog is the US.
amh: እንግዳ ነገር ነው በአለማችን ከሚገኙ ሰዎች በስታትስቲክሱ መሰረት በርካታ አንባቢዎቼ የሚገኙት በአሜሪካን ነው፡፡
mt0: It's a surprise that most of the people in the world are in America. Statistics show that most of my readers are in America.

en: There are those who have told me they read via Google Translator.
amh: በጉግል ትርጉም አማካኝነት በመጠቀም ፅሁፌን እንዳነበቡ የገለፁልኝም አሉ፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The majority congratulates me, gives me suggestions, and encourages me to carry on.
amh: አብዛኞቹ አንባቢዎቼ በርትቼ እንድቀጥልና እንድጠነክር ማበረታቻ ሃሳብ ይሰጡኛል፡፡
mt0: Most of my readers give me encouragement to continue and to grow.

en: Obviously there are always those who do not like it or take it the wrong way, I've even been challenged by someone telling me that I should take care with what I write.
amh: በሌላ በኩል በፍፁም ፅሑፌን የማይወዱና በተሳሳተ መንገድ የሚተረጉሙትም አሉ፡፡ ስለምፅፈው ፅሑፋ ጥንቃቄ እንድወስድ ማስጠንቀቂያ የሰጠኝ አንባቢም አለ፡፡
mt0: In the other hand, some people don't like my writing and translate it incorrectly. A reader also warned me to take care of my writing.

en: GV: What are your aspirations for the future?

mt0: GV: What are your future goals?

en: I am a person full of dreams, and if I start to recount all of my aspirations here, I will not even finish today.
amh: ወደፊት ብዙ ህልሞች ያሉኝ ሰው ነኝ፡፡
mt0: I have many dreams in the future.

en: But one of them, and really special, is to become a cronista in a newspaper or a magazine.
amh: ለወደፊት ማድረግ የምፈልጋቸው ትልሞቼን መዘርዘር ከጀመርኩ ዛሬ የምጨርስ አይመስለኝም ነገር ግን በጋዜጣ አሊያም በመፅሔት አምደኛ ሆኖ መፃፍ አንዱ ነው፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: It would be fantastic.
amh: አሪፍ ይሆናል፡፡
mt0: It will be very nice.

en: A public service announcement promoting condom use to combat the spread of HIV and other diseases in Kenya was recently pulled from the airwaves after the TV spot caused an uproar among the country's religious leaders.
amh: በቅርቡ ለህዝብ አገልግሎት ይውል ዘንድ HIV እና ተዛማጅ በሽታዎችን ለመከላከል የተላለፈ የኮንዶም ማስታወቂያ የተለያዩ የሃይማኖት ተቋማትን ማስቆጣቱን ተከትሎ በመገናኛ ብዙሃን እንዳይተላለፍ ታገዷል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: The advert, which shows a woman advising her married friend to use a condoms while engaging in an extramarital affair, was sponsored by Kenya's health ministry and foreign assistance agencies USAid and UKAid.
amh: የኬኒያ የጤና ጥበቃ ሚኒስቴር ፒተር ቼሩቲች ለBBC ዜና አገልግሎት እንደገለፁት ማስታወቂያው የተሠራው ከባለ ትዳሮች መካከል 30 በመቶዎቹ ከትዳር ውጪ ሌሎች ተጨማሪ ግንኙነቶች ስላላቸው ነው ብለዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The United Nations estimates about 1.6 million people out of the country's population of 41.6 million are living with HIV.
amh: የተባበሩት መንግሥታት ድርጅት ግምት ከሆነ ደግሞ ኬኒያ ካላት 41. 6 ሚሌኒየን ሕዝብ መካከል 1.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Christian and Muslim clergy condemned the advert as encouraging infidelity.
amh: 6 ሚሊየን ሕዝቦች HIV በደማቸው ውስጥ ይገኛል፡፡
mt0: 6 million people have HIV in their blood. If you can't translate it simply say you don't know.

en: Despite the advert being pulled from TV, it is still available on YouTube:
amh: የክርስቲያን እና የእስልምና ሃይማኖት መሪዎች ግን ማስታወቂያው ከትዳር ውጪ መወስለትን ያበረታታል ሲሉ አውግዘውታል፡፡
mt0: However, Christian and Muslim leaders have rejected the ad as it encourages divorce.

en: The Squared Factor blogger called the public service announcement spot on in a post titled Sikio la kufa halisikii Condom .
amh: የኮንዶም ማስታወቂያው ከኬኒያ ቴሌቨዥን ማሰራጫ ጣቢያዎች ላይ መተላለፉ ቢቀርም በዩቲዩብ ግን አሁንም መመልከት ይቻላል፡
mt0: If you can't translate the advertisement simply say you don't know.

en: The title, which loosely translates to a dying ear does not respond to a condom, is a play on the proverb a dying ear does not respond to medication:
amh: Sikio la kufa halisikii Condom” በሚል ርዕስ ባቀረበው ጽሑፍ በጥሬ ትርጉሙ የሚሞት ጆሮ ለኮንዶም ምላሽ የለውም የሚል ሲሆን ተመሳሳይ ተርጉሙም የሚሞት ጆሮ መዳኃኒት ቢሰጠውም መሞቱ አይቀርም ” በማለት ማስታወቂያው እንዲመለስ ጠይቋል፡፡
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know "Death ears don't respond to medications," he wrote in a letter titled "Death ears don't respond to medications." He also asked for the ad to be withdrawn.

en: I will not beat around this bush.
amh: ዙሪያ ጥምጥም አልሽከረከርም፡፡

en: And I frown at those clamoring for the recent TV ad titled weka condom mpangoni , to be withdrawn from the airwaves.

en: The message of this particular ad has unexpectedly tugged at the hem of society’s skirt: if you can’t abstain or commit to one partner, then use a condom if you care about your loved ones.

en: Several opposition leaders were arrested in Djibouti, a small, but strategically important country in the Horn of Africa, after demonstrations which followed the February 22, 2013 general elections.
amh: ትንሽ አገር ነገር ግን በአፍሪካ ቀንድ እጅግ በጣም ስትራቴጂክ አገር በሆነችው ጅቡቲ የየካቲት 15፣ 2005 አገር አቀፋዊ ምርጫን ተከትሎ በተደረገ የተቃውሞ ሰልፍ የተቃዋሚ ፓርቲ መሪዎች ታሰሩ፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know. A small country but a strategic country in the African continent, Zimbabwe was the scene of a protest following the 2005 national election.

mt0: In the election, the People's Rally for Progress (PRSP) party won again.

en: James Schneider from Think Africa Press has always believed that the elections only gave the appearance of democracy:

mt0: Jamie Schneider, the Turkish press secretary, always believes that elections are a sign of democracy: - the recent presidential election last year.

en: His most recent re-election, in 2011, came after he changed the constitution to be allowed to run for a third time; the vote took place without election observers and Guelleh won practically unopposed after the opposition withdrew citing harassment and the unfair nature of the poll Guelleh’s illusion will have worked, at least in the short term: he will still have power but now with the veneer of a parliamentary opposition.
amh: በ2011፣ ሕገ መንግሥቱ ለሦስተኛ ጊዜ አንድ ፕሬዝዳንት ዳግም እንዲመረጥ ፈቅዶ ከተቀየረ በኋላ የተደረገ ነው፡፡ ምርጫው የምርጫ ታዛቢዎች ባልተገኙበት ተደረገ እናም ጉሌህ ተቃዋሚ ፓርቲዎች እንግልት ደርሶብናል፣ ኢ-ፍትኃዊ ተግባራት ተፈፅመውብናል ብለው አቋርጠው በወጡበት ሁኔታ አሸነፈ፡፡
mt0: In 2011, the Constitution allowed a third time to elect a president. The election was conducted without observers and Gluck won in a situation where the opposition parties blocked the vote, saying that they were being abused and that they were being treated in a disrespectful way.

mt0: Today, October 16, 2006, was the day when Saudi activists chose to protest against the ban on women driving in the UK.

en: As social networks were buzzing under increasing number of reports of women driving across the country, a brilliant a capella remake of Bob Marley's No Woman, No Cry spread at the speed of light, in a sound support of brave women challenging conservative sexist legislation and pseudo-scientific justification of them being prohibited to enjoy freedom of movement:
amh: የማኅበራዊ አውታር ተጠቃሚዎች በአገሪቷ ውስጥ መኪና እየነዱ ስለታዩት ሴቶች ቁጥር መጨመር በስፋት እያወሩ ሳሉ፣ ተወዳጁ፣ የቦብ ማርሌይ ኖ ዉማን፣ ኖ ክራይ የተሰኘ ዜማ ሴቶችን በነጻነት የመንቀሳቀስ መብታቸውን ለመንፈግ የወጣ የወግ አጥባቂ ስርዓተ ፆታ ሕግን እና ሐሰተኛ የሳይንሳዊ ማብራሪያውን በሞገቱ ቆራጥ ሴቶች ድምፅ ድጋፍ ተቀይሮ በብርሃን ፍጥነት ሲሰራጭ ነበር፤
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The Web We Want invites cartoonists, creatives and artists to join The Day We Fight Back on February 11, 2014 by creating an original cartoon about online surveillance and the right to privacy.
amh: አ. በፌብሩዋሪ 11፣ 2014 የበይነመረብ ስለላን እና የግለሰብ ደኅንነት መብትን በተመለከተ ወጥ የካርቱኖች ውድድር ውስጥ እንዲሳተፉ እየጋበዘ ነው፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. On February 11th, 2014, the Internet Security and the Privacy Act invites citizens to participate in a voluntary tournament.

en: The cartoons should help increase awareness about the NSA and demand accountability for mass digital surveillance in a way that makes people want to click and share.
amh: ካርቱኖቹ በNSA (የአሜሪካው ብሔራዊ ደኅንነት ኤጀንሴ) ዙሪያ መረጃ ማስጨበጥ የሚችሉ እና በጥቅሉ ለሚደረጉ የበይነመረብ ስለላዎች ተጠያቂነትን የሚፈልጉ ሆነው ሰዎች ክሊክ አድርገው ለወዳጆቻቸው ሊያጋሯቸው የሚፈልጉት ዓይነት መሆን ይኖርባቸዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the card, just say you don't know. Cards should be like those people would like to share with friends as a collection of cards related to the NSA (US National Security Agency).

en: Deadline for submissions is February 8.

mt0: The date for the cards to be delivered must be before February 1.

amh: ነገር ግን ደራሲዎቹ እውነተኛ ስማቸው እንዲጠበቅ ከጠየቁ ይፋ አይደረግም፤
mt0: But if the writers ask for their real name to be protected, it won't be revealed.

amh: የተወዳዳሪዎች ዜግነት እና አገር አለመላክ ይቻላል ነገር ግን ቢላክ ይበረታታል፡፡

en: Blogging Ghana's proposed Social Media Hub.
amh: ጋናን ጡመራ (Blogging Ghana) ለተሰኘው የታሰበ የማኅበራዊ አውታር ቋት/ሰፈራ፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Ghana blogging.

en: Photo used with permission.
amh: (ፎቶው በባለቤቱ ፈቃድ ነው የተለጠፈው)
mt0: If you can't translate the picture just say you don't know. (The picture was posted with the owner's permission)

en: Internet penetration in Ghana is about 14 percent and has been on the up and up for the last decade as more Ghanaians, especially young people, have hooked up to the web.
amh: በጋና፣ የበይነመረብ ተዳራሽነት መጠን 14 በመቶ ገደማ ነው፤ በተጨማሪም ባለፉት ዐሥር ዓመታት በተለይም ወጣት ጋናውያን ከመረጃ መረብ ጋር መተዋወቃቸውን ተከትሎ እያደገ፣ እያደገ መጥቷል፡፡
mt0: In Ghana, the Internet is accessible to 14 percent of the population, and has grown exponentially over the past ten years, particularly among young Ghanaians who have been acquainted with the Internet.

en: As a result, the number of Ghanaians on various social media platforms is also increasing rapidly, and some now see a need for a physical social media hub to facilitate the activities of the many people who use social media or want to learn about it.
amh: በዚህም፣ ማኅበራዊ አውታር የሚጠቀሙ ሰዎች ቁጥር እየጨመረ በመምጣቱ አንዳንዶች የማኅበራዊ አውታር ተጠቃሚዎችና ስለምንነቱ መማር ለሚፈልጉትም ጭምር መሰባሰቢያ ስፍራ እንደሚያስፈልግ ታይቷቸዋል፡፡
mt0: This is because the number of people who use social media has increased. Some people have noticed that a meeting place is needed for social media users and those who want to learn about it.

en: Enter Blogging Ghana, the country's largest organization of bloggers and social media enthusiasts with more than 100 members.
amh: ጋናን ጡመራ (Blogging Ghana)ን ይመልከቱ፣ 100 አባላት ያክል ያሉት የአገሪቱ ጦማሪዎችና ማኅበራዊ አውታር ተጠቃሚዎች ትልቅ ስብስብ ነው፡፡
mt0: Look at Ghana's Blog, a large group of bloggers and social media users with 100 members.

en: The group launched a campaign on January 20, 2014 to establish Ghana's first ever social media hub, explaining on their website:
amh: ቡድኑ ጥር 12/2006 የጋናን የመጀመሪያውን የማኅበራዊ አውታር መሰባሰቢያ ቋት ለመመሥረት የሚያስችለውን ዘመቻ ድረገጹ ላይ በተደረገ ማብራሪያ ጀምሯል፡
mt0: The team began its campaign on January 12, 2006 by explaining the campaign on the site. If you cannot translate it simply say you don't know.

en: A physical meeting place, a hub, will go a long way to provide a platform for the experienced bloggers in the organisation to train students and professionals on how to use blogging for creating #MoreStories and use social media to advance their agenda as citizens in Ghana.
amh: በአካል መገናኛ ስፍራ፣ ቋት፣ ስብስቡ ውስጥ ያሉ ብዙ ልምድ ያላቸው ጦማሪዎች ተማሪዎችን እና ባለሙያዎችን ጡመራን ብዙ ትረካዎችን (#morestories) ለመፍጠር እንዴት መጠቀም እንደሚችሉ እና ማኅበራዊ አውታሮችን በመጠቀም እንደ ጋና ዜግነታቸው ተሳትፏቸውን ማበርከት እንዲችሉ ያስተምሯቸዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Africa on the Blog, a multi-author blog by people of African heritage, which is supported by Babs Saul and Sarah Arrow, explained the history of blogging in Ghana:
amh: አፍሪካ በጦማር የተሰኘ ብዙ ደራሲዎችን የአቀፈ በባብስ ሳዉል እና ሳራ አሮው የሚደገፍ የአፍሪካ ቅርስ ሰዎች የጡመራን ታሪክ በጋና አብራርተዋል፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: The blogging and social media scene in Ghana has improved in the last five years.
amh: ጡመራ እና ማኅበራዊ አውታር ተጠቃሚነት ባለፉት አምስት ዓመታት በጋና ዕድገት አሳይቷል፡፡
mt0: The use of internet and social media has shown a growth in Ghana in the past five years.

en: The West African country has seen the number of bloggers in the country grow from just a handful in 2005 to several hundreds this year.
amh: በ2005 ከነበሯት በጣት የሚቆጠሩ ጦማሪዎች ዛሬ ላይ በርካታ መቶዎች የሚሆኑ ጦማሪዎችን ለማየት በቅታለች፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: This trend was facilitated by a bold step taken by a Swedish blogger who had moved to Ghana some five years ago.
amh: ይህ ዕድገት አንድ ወደጋና የዛሬ አምስት ዓመት ገደማ የመጣ ስዊድናዊ በወሰደው ትልቅ ርምጃ ሊሳካ ችሏል፡፡
mt0: This development was achieved by a Swedish man who came to Geneva five years ago.

en: Kajsa Hallberg Adu who is now the Chair of Ghana’s biggest association of bloggers brought all the bloggers who were active online under one roof to discuss their passion.
amh: ካጅሳ ሆልበርግ አዱ፣ በአሁኑ ሰዓት የጋና ትልቁ የጦማሪዎች ማኅበር ሊቀመንበር ሲሆን በወቅቱ በይነመረብ ላይ በንቃት ይሳተፉ የነበሩትን ጦማሪዎች ሰብስቦ በአንድ ጣሪያ ስር ስለሥራዎቻቸው እንዲወያዩ አስችሏቸዋል፡፡
mt0: Currently the largest journalists' organization in Ghana, Captain Joel Bure, is the president of the largest journalists' organization in Ghana. He gathered the bloggers who were actively participating in the internet during the time he was a journalist.

en: With time, this small group of internet users decided to introduce blogging and the use of social media tools to many other people who may be interested but just didn’t know how.
amh: በጊዜ ሒደት፣ ይህ ትንሽ ቡድን ጡመራንና ማኅበራዊ አውታርን ባለማወቅ ዝም ያሉ ነገር ግን ቢያውቁ ኖሮ እነሱ እንደሚጠቀሙበት ሊጠቀሙበት የሚችሉ ሰዎችን ከማኅበራዊ አውታሮች ጋር ለማስተዋወቅ ወሰነ፡፡
mt0: In the course of time, this small group decided to introduce people to social media that they didn't know, but would have used it if they knew.

en: This selfish desire to spread such knowledge lead to what has today become the nation’s biggest blogging and social media event.
amh: ይህ ዕውቀትን የማሰራጨት የግል ፍላጎት ዛሬ አገሪቱ በጡመራ እና ማኅበራዊ አውታር አጠቃቀም ለደረሰችበት ደረጃ አድርሷታል፡፡
mt0: This individual desire to share knowledge has led to the reach of the country today in the use of forums and social media.

en: Edward Amartey-Tagoe, the director of corporate services at Blogging Ghana, also recounted how things were half a decade ago:

mt0: Eduardo Amarte-Tago, the director of company services at the Geneva Summit, remembers how things were five years ago.

en: Some five years ago, there were only a handful of bloggers in Ghana, since then, bloggers and Internet enthusiasts have been organised under one umbrella body to build capacity, learn and share ideas from one another.
amh: የዛሬ አምስት ዓመት ገደማ በጣት የሚቆጠሩ ጦማሪዎች ብቻ ነበሩ፤ ከዚያ ወዲህ ግን ጦማሪዎች እና የኢንተርኔት ወዳጆች በአንድ ጥላ ሥር ተደራጅተው አቅማቸውን ለመገንባት እና አንዱ ከሌላው ለመማርና ሐሳቦችን ለመለዋወጥ ችለዋል፡፡
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know Before five years, there were only a handful of bloggers; since then, bloggers and Internet friends have formed a network and developed their skills and learned from each other and exchanged ideas.

en: Today, we are an influential organisation with a yearly event and awards ceremony who produce local content online on blogs and on various social media channels.
amh: ዛሬ፣ ተፅዕኖ ፈጣሪ ስብስብ ከመሆናችንም ባሻገር በየዓመቱ ጥሩ አገራዊ ይዘት ያላቸውን ጦማሮች የሚጽፉትን የምንሸልምበት ደረጃ ላይ ደርሰናል፡፡
mt0: Today, we are a diverse group of influence, but we also reach a level where we can judge those who write good publications each year.

en: Social Media is growing in Ghana and we (Blogging Ghana) has over the past 5 years been a leader in Ghana.
amh: የማኅበራዊ አውታር በጋና እያደገ ነው፡፡ እና እኛ (ጋናን ጡመራ) ላለፉት አምስት ዓመታት በጋና የጡመራ መሪዎች ሆነናል፡፡
mt0: Social media is growing in Ghana. And we (Ganai Scouts) have been the leader of the Scouts in Ghana for five years.

en: In 2012, with funding from USAID, UKAID, EU & DANIDA, we used social media to cover Ghana’s elections; raising awareness of the issues and empowering politicians and citizens.

en: We want to do more and get more Ghanaians to use social media to tell their stories.

en: We want to overcome the internet and power challenges bloggers face.

en: We have therefore launched a crowdfunding campaign to create a haven/hub with a co-blogging space to and create the much needed local content.

mt0: For this, we have begun a campaign to raise money from the public to create a media center that can coordinate a joint search and publish local information.

en: We think Ghana in ready for a meeting place for social media enthusiasts and we cannot wait to create #morestories about Ghana for the world to read!
